details.title: Commentary: real education

p: Wayne Tustin 's first experience with vibration testing was at Boeing/Seattle around 1950 on the “X” version of that highly reliable airplane, still in service. The B-52's end of life is not yet seen. His training firm, Equipment Reliability Institute, conducts “on site” reliability training as well as “open” courses to which individuals may be sent.
His previous publications in this TRANSACTIONSwere (many years ago):
• 1983 October issue: “Comment on: Reliability of photovoltaic devices and systems”
• 1985 August issue: “Book review: Random vibration in perspective.”

details.abstract: In general, we don¿t really know the real world and all the ways in which hardware and software will be used (and misused). We are pretty naive when we think we can simulate the real world. Rather than let failures happen in the field, it is urged that one should find weaknesses in the lab, ideally as part of development.
